wikitext.*:
'''Lëa-vinya''' ([[Quenya|Q.]]''Lëa the Young'') was a [[Maia]] and the wife of [[Tulkas]] in a late revision of the [[legendarium]].<ref name=Lea>{{MR|P2d}}, pp. 66-7</ref>

== History ==
Lëa-vinya was described as being the "highest of the Maiar", along with [[Estë|Estë the Pale]], though neither ever attended the councils of the [[Valar]].<ref group="note">Lëa-vinya is not, however, synonymous with [[Nessa]], the wife of Tulkas in ''[[The Silmarillion]]'', since both Lëa and Nessa appeared together in the same writings.</ref><ref name=Lea/>

It was said that at a feast during the [[Spring of Arda]], Tulkas espoused Lëa-vinya, who was associated with the maidens of [[Yavanna]], being the fairest of them. Lëa-vinya danced before the Valar as [[Vána]] clothed her with the first flowers that bloomed.<ref name=Lea/>

== Etymology ==
''Lëa-vinya'' is [[Quenya]] for "Lëa the Young",<ref name=Lea/> possibly from the root ''[[Lay]]'' ("be alive, flourish") and the word ''[[Vinya]]'' ("young, new") as speculated on [[Eldamo]].<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-3846503457.html|articlename=Q. ''Lëa-vinya'' f.|website=[[Eldamo]]|accessed=}}</ref>
